text:
Dee Dee Ramone (or Douglas Glenn Colvin; September 18, 1951 – June 5, 2002) was a German-American singer, songwriter and musician. He was best known for being a founding member of the Ramones.
He was mostly a punk rock singer, although he did some hip hop.
Ramone was born in Fort Lee, Virginia. He died from a heroin overdose, aged 50.
